ygData.subject: Re: Starting smithing...
ygData.msgSnippet: No NO NO, you need to make lanterns after scalers... then make skewers. Lanterns have good skill gain. They helped me allot. ... From: XxKommiexX@aol.com
ygData.messageBody:
No NO NO, you need to make lanterns after scalers... then make skewers.
Lanterns have good skill gain. They helped me allot.

-----Original Message-----
From: XxKommiexX@... [mailto:XxKommiexX@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 12:45 PM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Starting smithing...


From: XxKommiexX@...

I disagree. 21 is when bits become trivial. Then make scalers until 41, that

is when they become trivial. Then after that make skewers until 115. That is

when they become trivial. I tried making banded before this, and everyone
always wanted other banded items. Everyone has gorgets and bracers, they are

the cheapest thing out there. Once 115 make all banded. You will fail a lot
on some things. Sometimes you will have a bad spout. Failing 10 times in a
row at 121 skill in Legs really sucks. once your that high, just keep making

banded. and your skill will raise.

Danthin, Master Smith (123)
~Veeshan~
